 6	namespace Comp1551_ApplicationDev_CW
 7	{
 8	 /// <summary>
 9	 /// Abstract base class for all question types in the geography quiz
 10	 /// This class demonstrates key OOP principles:
 11	 /// - ABSTRACTION: Defines common interface that all questions must implement
 12	 /// - ENCAPSULATION: Private fields with controlled public access
 13	 /// - INHERITANCE: Base class that other question types inherit from
 14	 /// </summary>
 15	 public abstract class Question
 16	 {
 17	 // Private fields - demonstrates ENCAPSULATION principle
 18	 // These fields can only be accessed through public properties
 19	 private string _questionText; // Stores the actual question text
 20	 private string _category; // Stores the question category (e.g., "Geography")
 21	
 22	 /// <summary>
 23	 /// Public property for accessing question text with validation
 24	 /// Demonstrates ENCAPSULATION - controlled access to private field
 25	 /// </summary>
 26	 public string QuestionText
 27	 {
 28	 get => _questionText; // Return the private field value
 29	 set => _questionText = value ?? throw new ArgumentNullException(nameof(value)); // Validate input - prevent null values
 30	 }
 31	
 32	 /// <summary>M
 33	 /// Public property for accessing question category with default value
 34	 /// Demonstrates ENCAPSULATION with automatic default assignment
 35	 /// </summary>
 36	 public string Category
 37	 {
 38	 get => _category; // Return the private field value
 39	 set => _category = value ?? "General"; // Set value or use default if null
 40	 }
 41	
 42	 /// <summary>
 43	 /// Protected constructor - can only be called by derived classes
 44	 /// This enforces that Question objects can only be created through specific question types
 45	 /// </summary>
 46	 /// <param name="questionText">The text of the question to display</param>
 47	 /// <param name="category">The category of the question (defaults to "Geography")</param>
 48	 protected Question(string questionText, string category = "Geography")
 49	 {
 50	 QuestionText = questionText; // Use property to ensure validation
 51	 Category = category; // Use property to ensure default handling
 52	 }
 53	
 54	 /// <summary>
 55	 /// Abstract method to check if the provided answer is correct
 56	 /// ABSTRACTION: Must be implemented by each derived class with their own logic
 57	 /// POLYMORPHISM: Each question type will have different implementation
 58	 /// </summary>
 59	 /// <param name="userAnswer">The answer provided by the user</param>
 60	 /// <returns>True if the answer is correct, false otherwise</returns>
 61	 public abstract bool IsCorrect(string userAnswer);
 62	
 63	 /// <summary>
 64	 /// Abstract method to get the correct answer(s) for display purposes
 65	 /// ABSTRACTION: Each question type formats their answer differently
 66	 /// Used when showing results to the user
 67	 /// </summary>
 68	 /// <returns>String representation of the correct answer(s)</returns>
 69	 public abstract string GetCorrectAnswer();
 70	
 71	 /// <summary>
 72	 /// Abstract method to get the question type for UI purposes
 73	 /// ABSTRACTION: Each derived class returns its specific type
 74	 /// Used for displaying question type in the interface
 75	 /// </summary>
 76	 /// <returns>String describing the question type (e.g., "Multiple Choice")</returns>
 77	 public abstract string GetQuestionType();
 78	 }

 42	 public class MultipleChoiceQuestion : Question
 43	 {
 44	 // Private fields for storing multiple choice specific data
 45	 private List<string> _options; // Stores the 4 answer options (A, B, C, D)
 46	 private int _correctOptionIndex; // Stores which option is correct (0-3)
 47	
 48	 /// <summary>
 49	 /// Public property to access the answer options
 50	 /// ENCAPSULATION: Returns a copy of the list to prevent external modification
 51	 /// This protects the internal data while allowing read access
 52	 /// </summary>
 53	 public List<string> Options
 54	 {
 55	 get => new List<string>(_options); // Return copy to maintain encapsulation - prevents external changes
 56	 private set => _options = value ?? throw new ArgumentNullException(nameof(value)); // Private setter with validation
 57	 }
 58	
 59	 /// <summary>
 60	 /// Public property to access the correct option index
 61	 /// ENCAPSULATION: Validates that the index is within valid range (0-3)
 62	 /// </summary>
 63	 public int CorrectOptionIndex
 64	 {
 65	 get => _correctOptionIndex; // Return the index of correct answer
 66	 private set
 67	 {
 68	 // Validation: ensure the index is valid for the options list
 69	 if (value < 0 || value >= _options.Count)
 70	 throw new ArgumentOutOfRangeException(nameof(value));

 75	 /// <summary>

 77	 /// Calls base class constructor and validates multiple choice specific requirements

 79	 /// <param name="questionText">The question to ask the user</param>
 80	 /// <param name="options">List of exactly 4 answer options</param>
 81	 /// <param name="correctOptionIndex">Index (0-3) of the correct option</param>
 82	 /// <param name="category">Question category (defaults to "Geography")</param>
 83	 public MultipleChoiceQuestion(string questionText, List<string> options, int correctOptionIndex, string category = "Geography")
 84	 : base(questionText, category) // Call parent constructor first
 85	 {

 108	 }

 110	 return false;

 89	 /// <summary>
 90	 /// Open-ended question implementation - demonstrates INHERITANCE and flexible answer matching
 91	 /// Inherits from Question base class and implements text-based answer checking
 92	 /// Supports multiple correct answers and handles variations in user input (e.g., "UK" vs "United Kingdom")
 93	 /// </summary>
 94	 public class OpenEndedQuestion : Question
 95	 {
 96	 // Private field to store all acceptable correct answers
 97	 private List<string> _correctAnswers; // Can store multiple variations like ["London", "london", "LONDON"]
 98	
 99	 /// <summary>
 100	 /// Public property to access correct answers
 101	 /// ENCAPSULATION: Returns copy to prevent external modification of internal list
 102	 /// </summary>
 103	 public List<string> CorrectAnswers
 104	 {
 105	 get => new List<string>(_correctAnswers); // Return defensive copy
 106	 private set => _correctAnswers = value ?? throw new ArgumentNullException(nameof(value)); // Validate not null
 107	 }
 108	
 109	 /// <summary>
 110	 /// Constructor for creating an open-ended question
 111	 /// Allows multiple acceptable answers for flexibility (e.g., "UK", "United Kingdom", "Britain")
 112	 /// </summary>
 113	 /// <param name="questionText">The question to ask the user</param>
 114	 /// <param name="correctAnswers">List of all acceptable correct answers</param>
 115	 /// <param name="category">Question category (defaults to "Geography")</param>
 116	 public OpenEndedQuestion(string questionText, List<string> correctAnswers, string category = "Geography")
 117	 : base(questionText, category) // Call parent constructor
 118	 {
 119	 // Validation: Must have at least one correct answer
 120	 if (correctAnswers == null || correctAnswers.Count == 0)
 121	 throw new ArgumentException("Must provide at least one correct answer");
 122	
 123	 CorrectAnswers = correctAnswers; // Use property for validation
 124	 }
 125	
 126	 /// <summary>
 127	 /// POLYMORPHISM: Override abstract method to implement text-based answer checking
 128	 /// Uses flexible matching to handle variations in user input
 129	 /// Compares normalized versions of answers to be more forgiving
 130	 /// </summary>
 131	 /// <param name="userAnswer">Text answer provided by the user</param>
 132	 /// <returns>True if user answer matches any acceptable answer, false otherwise</returns>
 133	 public override bool IsCorrect(string userAnswer)
 134	 {
 135	 // Check for empty/null input
 136	 if (string.IsNullOrWhiteSpace(userAnswer))
 137	 return false;
 138	
 139	 // Normalize user's answer (remove punctuation, standardize case, etc.)
 140	 string normalizedUserAnswer = NormalizeAnswer(userAnswer);
 141	
 142	 // Check if normalized user answer matches any of the normalized correct answers
 143	 // LINQ Any() method checks if any element in the collection matches the condition
 144	 return _correctAnswers.Any(answer =>
 145	 NormalizeAnswer(answer).Equals(normalizedUserAnswer, StringComparison.OrdinalIgnoreCase));
 146	 }
 147	
 148	 /// <summary>
 149	 /// Private helper method to normalize answers for flexible comparison
 150	 /// Removes common punctuation and formatting differences
 151	 /// Makes comparison case-insensitive and handles common variations
 152	 /// </summary>
 153	 /// <param name="answer">Raw answer string to normalize</param>
 154	 /// <returns>Normalized string for comparison</returns>
 155	 private string NormalizeAnswer(string answer)
 156	 {
 157	 return answer.Trim() // Remove leading/trailing spaces
 158	 .Replace(".", "") // Remove periods
 159	 .Replace(",", "") // Remove commas
 160	 .Replace("'", "") // Remove apostrophes
 161	 .Replace("-", " ") // Convert hyphens to spaces
 162	 .ToLowerInvariant(); // Convert to lowercase for case-insensitive comparison
 163	 }
 164	
 165	 /// <summary>
 166	 /// POLYMORPHISM: Override abstract method to format all correct answers for display
 167	 /// Shows all acceptable answers separated by " / " for user feedback
 168	 /// </summary>
 169	 /// <returns>String showing all acceptable answers</returns>
 170	 public override string GetCorrectAnswer()
 171	 {
 172	 // Join all correct answers with " / " separator (e.g., "Russia / Russian Federation")
 173	 return string.Join(" / ", _correctAnswers);
 174	 }
 175	
 176	 /// <summary>
 177	 /// POLYMORPHISM: Override abstract method to identify question type
 178	 /// Used by UI to determine how to display the question (text input box)
 179	 /// </summary>
 180	 /// <returns>String identifying this as an open-ended question</returns>
 181	 public override string GetQuestionType()
 182	 {
 183	 return "Open-Ended";
 184	 }
 185	 }

 140	 /// <summary>
 141	 /// True/False question implementation - demonstrates INHERITANCE and boolean logic
 142	 /// Inherits from Question base class and implements binary choice questions
 143	 /// Handles statements that are either true or false
 144	 /// </summary>
 145	 public class TrueFalseQuestion : Question
 146	 {
 147	 // Private field to store the correct boolean answer
 148	 private bool _correctAnswer; // true = statement is correct, false = statement is incorrect
 149	
 150	 /// <summary>
 151	 /// Public property to access the correct boolean answer
 152	 /// ENCAPSULATION: Controlled access to private field
 153	 /// </summary>
 154	 public bool CorrectAnswer
 155	 {
 156	 get => _correctAnswer; // Return the boolean value
 157	 private set => _correctAnswer = value; // Simple assignment (boolean validation not needed)
 158	 }
 159	
 160	 /// <summary>
 161	 /// Constructor for creating a true/false question
 162	 /// Takes a statement and whether that statement is true or false
 163	 /// </summary>
 164	 /// <param name="questionText">The statement to evaluate (e.g., "The Earth is flat")</param>
 165	 /// <param name="correctAnswer">Whether the statement is true (true) or false (false)</param>
 166	 /// <param name="category">Question category (defaults to "Geography")</param>
 167	 public TrueFalseQuestion(string questionText, bool correctAnswer, string category = "Geography")
 168	 : base(questionText, category) // Call parent constructor
 169	 {
 170	 CorrectAnswer = correctAnswer; // Set the correct answer using property
 171	 }
 172	
 173	 /// <summary>
 174	 /// POLYMORPHISM: Override abstract method to implement true/false answer checking
 175	 /// Handles multiple input formats: boolean values, text representations, and common abbreviations
 176	 /// Very flexible to handle different ways users might input true/false
 177	 /// </summary>
 178	 /// <param name="userAnswer">User's answer in various possible formats</param>
 179	 /// <returns>True if user's answer matches the correct boolean value</returns>
 180	 public override bool IsCorrect(string userAnswer)
 181	 {
 182	 // First try to parse as a direct boolean value
 183	 if (bool.TryParse(userAnswer, out bool boolAnswer))
 184	 {
 185	 return boolAnswer == _correctAnswer;
 186	 }
 187	
 188	 // Handle string representations - normalize input for flexible matching
 189	 string normalized = userAnswer.Trim().ToLowerInvariant();
 190	
 191	 // Check for "true" variations
 192	 if (normalized == "true" || normalized == "t" || normalized == "yes" || normalized == "y")
 193	 return _correctAnswer == true; // User said true, check if correct answer is true
 194	
 195	 // Check for "false" variations
 196	 if (normalized == "false" || normalized == "f" || normalized == "no" || normalized == "n")
 197	 return _correctAnswer == false; // User said false, check if correct answer is false
 198	
 199	 // If input doesn't match any recognized format, it's incorrect
 200	 return false;
 201	 }
 202	
 203	 /// <summary>
 204	 /// POLYMORPHISM: Override abstract method to format correct answer for display
 205	 /// Returns simple "True" or "False" string for user feedback
 206	 /// </summary>
 207	 /// <returns>String representation of correct boolean answer</returns>
 208	 public override string GetCorrectAnswer()
 209	 {
 210	 // Use ternary operator to convert boolean to string
 211	 return _correctAnswer ? "True" : "False";
 212	 }
 213	
 214	 /// <summary>
 215	 /// POLYMORPHISM: Override abstract method to identify question type
 216	 /// Used by UI to determine how to display the question (True/False buttons)
 217	 /// </summary>
 218	 /// <returns>String identifying this as a true/false question</returns>
 219	 public override string GetQuestionType()
 220	 {
 221	 return "True/False";
 222	 }
 223	 }
 224	} // End of namespace

 99	 public bool SubmitAnswer(string userAnswer)
 100	 {

 102	 return false;
 103	
 104	 Question currentQuestion = _questions[_currentQuestionIndex];
 105	 bool isCorrect = currentQuestion.IsCorrect(userAnswer);

 108	 _userResponses.Add(userAnswer ?? "");
 109

 111	
 112	 if (_currentQuestionIndex >= _questions.Count)
 113	 {
 114	 _gameTimer.Stop();
 115	 IsGameInProgress = false;
